definition: to sting or bite (of mosquito, bee etc)/to say repeatedly/to urge insistently/to ask repeatedly/to stick to a point/(onom.) tinkling or jingling sound
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
lit. if you tap a half-empty bottle it makes a sound (idiom)/fig. empty vessels make the most noise/one who has a little knowledge likes to show off, but one who is truly knowledgeable is modest
pinyin: ban4 ping2 shui3 xiang3 ding1 dang1

sentences.english: It's a tradition to sing "Jingle Bells" at Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节唱《铃儿响叮当》是一种传统。

sentences.english: This man talked with Manuel, and money chinked between them.
sentences.chinese: 这人跟曼纽尔谈了谈，钱在他俩之间叮当响。

sentences.english: Tink, we just want you to be happy.
sentences.chinese: 小叮当，我们只是想让你快乐一些。

sentences.english: Then he heard a clanking noise deep down below .
sentences.chinese: 接着他听见地下深处传来一阵叮当声。

sentences.english: Big old Tinker. He's chased mountain lions before.
sentences.chinese: 老叮当这个大家伙，它以前追过山狮呢。

sentences.english: The bell tinkled as he opened the shop door.
sentences.chinese: 他打开商店门时铃声叮当响起。

sentences.english: From brightly lit windows came the tinkle of laughter and the sound of singing.
sentences.chinese: 从明亮的窗户传来了笑声叮当声和歌声。

sentences.english: He jingled the money in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他把兜里的钱弄得叮当响。

sentences.english: IT BEGAN on August 4th with the metallic clink of a few pots and pans.
sentences.chinese: 始于8月4日，几只铁罐和铁锅叮叮当当地响。

sentences.english: Tinker Bell doesn't went to help Wendy.
sentences.chinese: 小叮当不想去帮助温蒂。

sentences.english: Tinker Bell's going to save us with her dopey little doohickeys .
sentences.chinese: 用小叮当的小玩意拯救大家吗？

sentences.english: I was poor, and put money in art that others regard it as rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 狂热，穷得叮当响，把钱投在别人认为的“垃圾”里。

sentences.english: The bell twinkles when you open the door.
sentences.chinese: 一开门，门铃就叮当作响。

sentences.english: We heard clink come from that room.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到那个屋子传来叮当声。

sentences.english: Now, Tinker Bell, are you sure you can do this?
sentences.chinese: 现在，小叮当，你确定要这么做吗？

definition: (onom.) to rumble (of a stomach)/to coo (of a dove)/rumbling/noisy drinking sound
(onom.) quack/honk/(northern dialect) very/also pr. [ga1 ga5], [ga2 ga5] etc
Sa'gya town and county, Tibetan: Sa skya, in Shigatse prefecture, central Tibet/saga (i.e. heroic tale)
Xiaojin county (Tibetan: btsan lha rdzong) in Ngawa Tibetan and Qiang autonomous prefecture 阿壩藏族羌族自治州|阿坝藏族羌族自治州[A1 ba4 Zang4 zu2 Qiang1 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], northwest Sichuan
(onom.) clang/clank of metal/sound of striking a gong
